recipe.title: White bread
recipe.ingredients: 5 g (1 tsp) active yeast approximately 180 ml lukewarm water 300 g (2 C) strong flour 1 1/2 tbsp milk powder 1 tsp salt 1 tsp sugar 15 g butter, cold but pliable egg wash, see page 64 sesame seeds or poppy seeds for coating
recipe.steps: Mix the yeast with some of the warm water and set aside. Sieve dry ingredients together. Mix in the yeast and enough warm water to form a dough. Knead well. Mix in the butter and continue kneading until smooth and elastic. Place in an oiled bowl and cover with a damp cloth or plastic wrap. Place in a warm place to prove until double in size. When half risen, knock back, then continue proving. When dough has doubled in size, shape the dough as required. If not baking in a tin, place the shaped dough on a lightly greased tray or baking paper. Egg wash and top with sesame or poppy seeds if required. Prove in a warm place until correctly risen. Heat the oven to 230 °C. Either spray cold water into the oven or place a container of ice cubes into the base of the oven. Bake the bread for 15—20 minutes.
